prompt_text: Try writing something you would be embarrassed to show to a friend.
Portray your situation from an alien perspective.
How would you write this 100 years ago?
Write one letter at a time.
Think of the most unlikely ending, and begin with that.
Go outside, breathe the air, come back inside, and try again.
Take a nap and try again.
Try something that you think is beyond your capabilities.
Make something ambiguous explicit.
Make something explicit ambiguous.
How do all the parts fit together? Can they be taken apart? Put together differently?
If there are two paths you can take, can you take both?
Write it badly on purpose, and start from there.
Write out whatever is in your mind this second, however irrelevant.
Make something extreme more comfortable.
Make something comfortable more extreme.
Try changing all the vowels.
Have you been drinking enough water?
Are you hiding something that should be shared?
Fill an empty space.
Open up an empty space.
How would your friend write this?
Be more impulsive.
Write it as if you were happier than you are.
How is writing like music? How not?
How is writing like a game? How not?
How is writing like a painting? How not?
How is writing like a sculpture? How not?
What advice would you give if your friend wrote this?
Make something perfect less perfect.
Repeat something until it changes.
What don't you want to write?
Be self-indulgent and pay attention to yourself while you're doing it.
How would you write this 100 years from now?
How would you explain this to a child?
Try writing more slowly.
Try writing more quickly.
Be brave!
Say everything out loud before you write it.
What's the worst that could happen?
